author: Nick Maludy
comment: This is a great podcasting application, the best I've found. My only criticism is that I can't find the "New Podcasts" or "Downloaded Podcasts" pages. Periodically when the app syncs it gives me two notifications one about X number of new podcasts, another about Y number of downloaded podcasts. Clicking on those notifications brings me to a nice screen with those new items displayed. If I accidentally close the app, or silence the notification I have no way of returning to those screens until I receive another notification (the next time one of my podcasts publishes new content). Please, if you could, add links to those pages so they can be visited on demand, instead of simply through the notifications.  Edit: Based on you're comment I've given this a 5 star. I have to say this is exactly why I love this application. Everything is configurable!!! Also, amazing support, thanks for your help!

reply.author: Xavier Guillemane
reply.content: You will find the downloaded episodes page in the navigation sidebar. You can open the Recent episodes page to see episodes published for the past 7 days. They will include the latest episodes. If you prefer to access the new episodes screen from the navigation sidebar you can go into Settings/Sliding menu to add this entry

Even when I'm on WiFi and my phone is not moving, the app will stop playing the podcast. It is not that it is searching for a signal, it just stops playing. But that said, I still recommend it.

Thank you!

You don't have to download episodes in order to listen to them. You can stream them if you prefer.

author: 2Karl Tessier-Ashpool

This is the only important thing in my life now. I have divorced my wife, killed my dog and burned my home to the ground. When you open the app it displays the last unfinished episodes in the player bar so you can just press play to resume playback. You don t have to use any advanced feature if you don t need them. In fact you can use the app without opening any menu if the default settings/behavior suits you.
Pls contact me in case you have question Settings/Feedback

From a technical standpoint at least Podcast Addict allows RSS feeds and doesn't constantly lose my place in lengthy episodes. I plan on using this app exclusively for my podcasts going forward so I may update this review after figuring it out but my initial impressions are not good.

reply.author: Xavier Guillemane

Every button in the app is labeled. In order to add a podcast you need to press on the main screen toolbar + button. Then you can select how you want to add the podcast: search engine,  RSS feed or browsing popular podcasts. You can listen to episodes in any order you want to.Pls send me an email in case you have any question(Settings/Feedback)
